alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 1:33AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Dawson, Gosper and Phelps. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, as well as ponding of water in urban areas, is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Gallagher Canyon State Recreation Area, Plum Creek, Johnson Lake Area, Turkey Creek, Elk Creek, Elwood Reservoir Area, Spring Creek, Elm Creek, and Buffalo Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bertrand, Elwood, Smithfield and Johnson Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
